scenario_text.value: Hey, Takuma! Look at this!
A mark...on the wall?

It seems more recent than the other damage.
Piedmon might have left this.
He could have scraped the wall.

Even still, you did a great job to find that
little mark.

Well... I have to give it my all.
I’ll keep looking.

(Does praise confuse her? That didn’t seem
like an embarrassed reaction.)

(She found a great clue. I don’t want to
change her attitude, though.)

(Should I ask her if something’s wrong?
Or should I leave it be?)
(What should I say to Aoi?)
Did I embarrass you?
You’re doing great.
Keep it up!
Did I embarrass you?
Did my compliment embarrass you, Aoi?
Is that what you thought?

I’m sorry, but I don’t think this is the best
time to just be happy about a compliment.
Even so, your hard work is incredible.

Forget about that for now, Takuma!
Hang on. That’s not what I mean...
You’re doing great.

It’s amazing to see your results.
You’re doing a great job!
What are you talking about?
Wait, Aoi?

If I had done a great job, we wouldn’t be in
this situation to begin with.
It’s not your fault...
No... I’m sorry. Now’s not the time for this.
Keep it up!
Thanks, Aoi! Keep it up!

Keep spotting these clues, and we’ll
definitely find Miyuki and Piedmon.
You’re right! I’m glad I’m helping!

But... I’m sorry.
Now’s not the time to be happy.

Anyway...does this mark make it look like
they’re heading north?
To the north? I can see a building there.
But we haven’t found a way to get there yet.
Let’s look for one. I’ll be quick. Wait here!
Aoi...

Let her stay focused. I’m sure the fear is
keeping her moving like that.
All right, yeah. I see what you mean.

(It’s fine as long as the fear pushes her on.
But I’m worried she’ll explode.)

I shouldn’t have rushed ahead like that.
I want to be helpful.

(Oh yeah, I wonder if the professor’s feeling
any better?)
(I should go <color=#B41919>check on him</color>.)
